channel.title: Ubuntu Linux
channel.description: Argghhhhhhh, I can't my server to work on Ubuntu... Error:[code=Java]brandon@brandon-ET1331G:~/Desktop/SageScape$ sh 1Run.sh Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:217) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:205) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:321) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:294) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:266) . Program will exit.ain class: server : not found : not found brandon@brandon-ET1331G:~/Desktop/SageScape$ [/code] Shell code[code=Java]#!/bin/bash java -Xmx1200m server[/code] Batch file for windows(works on windows)[code=Java]@echo off color c title SageScape java -noverify -javaagent:"C:\Program Files\ZeroTurnaround\JRebel\JRebel.jar" server java -Xmx1200m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server pause [/code]Any help please. :'(

item.title: Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

I’m good, I have a stable base. I’ve been using my own for a while, I just switched to ubuntu. When I try to install jdk, it says:INstaller : Wrapper.CreateFIle failed with error 123: Invalid name. I downloaded the newest version of jdk for windows, from the java website.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

You mean:-cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server? Ifso, that doesn’t work.You get[code]Usage: java [-options] class [args…]
(to execute a class)
or java [-options] -jar jarfile [args…]
(to execute a jar file)
where options include:
-d32 use a 32-bit data model if available
-d64 use a 64-bit data model if available
-server to select the “server” VM
-cacao to select the “cacao” VM
-zero to select the “zero” VM
The default VM is server.

-cp <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
-classpath <class search path of directories and zip/jar files>
              A : separated list of directories, JAR archives,
              and ZIP archives to search for class files.
-D<name>=<value>
              set a system property
-verbose[:class|gc|jni]
              enable verbose output
-version      print product version and exit
-version:<value>
              require the specified version to run
-showversion  print product version and continue
-jre-restrict-search | -jre-no-restrict-search
              include/exclude user private JREs in the version search
-? -help      print this help message
-X            print help on non-standard options
-ea[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-enableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              enable assertions with specified granularity
-da[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
-disableassertions[:<packagename>...|:<classname>]
              disable assertions with specified granularity
-esa | -enablesystemassertions
              enable system assertions
-dsa | -disablesystemassertions
              disable system assertions
-agentlib:<libname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library <libname>, e.g. -agentlib:hprof
              see also, -agentlib:jdwp=help and -agentlib:hprof=help
-agentpath:<pathname>[=<options>]
              load native agent library by full pathname
-javaagent:<jarpath>[=<options>]
              load Java programming language agent, see java.lang.instrument
-splash:<imagepath>
              show splash screen with specified image

See http://java.sun.com/javase/reference for more details.
1Run.sh: 2: ./jython.jar: Permission denied
1Run.sh: 2: ./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar: not found
: not found[/code]EDIT: BTW, I use 64 bit Ubuntu 10.10, if that matters.

Read full topic
